name: Ext.data.schema.Reference
doc:
This is not a real JavaScript class and cannot be created. This is for documentation purposes only.

This documentation is for:

  • reference config

The name of the entity referenced by this field. In most databases, this relationship is represented by a "foreign key". That is, a value for such a field matches the value of the id for an entity of this type.

 Ext.define('MyApp.models.Organization', {
     extend: 'Ext.data.Model',
     ...
 });

 Ext.define('MyApp.models.User', {
     extend: 'Ext.data.Model',

     fields: [
         { name: 'organizationId', reference: 'Organization' }
     ],
     ...
 });

If the name of the generated association or other aspects need to be specified, the reference can be an object. The following usage shows what would be generated by default given the above examples using the string form.

 Ext.define('MyApp.models.User', {
     extend: 'Ext.data.Model',

     fields: [{
         name: 'organizationId',
         reference: {
             type: 'Organization',
             association: 'UsersByOrganization',
             role: 'organization',
             inverse: 'users'
         }
     }],
     ...
 });

Finally, a reference can also describe ownership between the entities. By default, no ownership relationship is assumed. If, however, the User entities are owned by their Organization, we could say this:

 Ext.define('MyApp.models.User', {
     extend: 'Ext.data.Model',

     fields: [{
         name: 'organizationId',
         reference: {
             parent: 'Organization' // Organization is the parent of User
         }
     }],
     ...
 });

members.name: association
members.doc: The name of the association. By default, the name of the association is the capitalized inverse plus "By" plus the capitalized role.

members.name: child
members.doc: Set this property instead of reference.type to indicate that the referenced entity is an owned child of this entity. That is, the reference entity should be deleted when this entity is deleted.
members.short_doc:
Set this property instead of reference.type to indicate that the referenced entity
is an owned child of this entity. ...

members.name: getterName
members.doc: The name of the getter function. Typically this is generated based on the role.
members.short_doc: The name of the getter function. ...

members.name: inverse
members.doc:
The name of the inverse role (of this entity with respect to the reference entity). By default, this is the pluralized name of this entity, unless this reference is unique, in which case the default name is the singularized name of this entity.

This config may also be an object containing a role, getter, or setter.
members.short_doc:
The name of the inverse role (of this entity with respect to the reference
entity). ...
members.html_type: String/Object

members.name: parent
members.doc: Set this property instead of reference.type to indicate that the referenced entity is the owning parent of this entity. That is, this entity should be deleted when the reference entity is deleted.
members.short_doc:
Set this property instead of reference.type to indicate that the referenced entity
is the owning parent of this entity. ...

members.name: reader
members.doc: A custom Ext.data.reader.Reader configuration for reading nested data.

members.name: role
members.doc: The name of the role played by the referenced entity. By default, this is the field name (minus its "Id" suffix if present).
members.short_doc: The name of the role played by the referenced entity. ...

members.name: setterName
members.doc: The name of the setter function (if required). Typically this is generated based on the role.
members.short_doc: The name of the setter function (if required). ...

members.name: type
members.doc: The type which this field references. This is the value set by the string form of reference. If the referenced entity has an ownership relationship this field should be omitted and reference.parent or reference.child should be specified instead.
members.short_doc: The type which this field references. ...

members.name: unique
members.doc: true True for this reference to create a Ext.data.schema.OneToOne relationship. If not specified, the default is Ext.data.schema.ManyToOne.
members.short_doc:
true True for this reference to create a Ext.data.schema.OneToOne
relationship. ...

short_doc: This is not a real JavaScript class and cannot be created. ...
